member.name: T:Subdivisionary.MappingProfile
member.summary: Dto stands for Data Transfer Objects. They are responcible for Transfering Data into our model in our API. They mirror our model classes, but without certain info for added security. Another advantage of DTOs is that they provide a contract with the end-user such that the api versions itself at a slower pace than our api, allowing for better consistancy over time. We use Auto-Mapper to map the properties between these classes

member.name: M:Subdivisionary.MappingProfile.#ctor
member.summary: Configure Mapping Profile with System.reflection

member.summary: This class will create an object of a given type and populate it with sample data.

member.name: M:Subdivisionary.Areas.HelpPage.ObjectGenerator.GenerateObject(System.Type)
member.summary: Generates an object for a given type. The type needs to be public, have a public default constructor and settable public properties/fields. Currently it supports the following types: Simple types: , , , , , etc. Complex types: POCO types. Nullables: . Arrays: arrays of simple types or complex types. Key value pairs: Tuples: , , etc Dictionaries: or anything deriving from . Collections: , , , , , or anything deriving from or . Queryables: , .
member.returns: An object of the given type.

member.summary: Log In through API with a string provider. NOTE: You can also use the /Token endpoint in to get the authorization cookie.

member.name: M:Subdivisionary.Controllers.Api.AccountController.Logout
member.summary: POST api/Account/Logout try calling this method before logging out, but you don't have to. NOTE: you must 'forget' your cookie in order to properly log out. API calls will still be authorized if you don't remove the variable on your end as well.

member.name: T:Subdivisionary.ExternalApis.ExternalApi
member.summary: Class that facilitates external Web API calls. Takes care of all the back-end technicals with calling a web-api using C#. Also is the base-class for all SAS triggers to external APIs See Microsoft's Web-Api Documentation Here: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/aspnet/web-api/overview/advanced/calling-a-web-api-from-a-net-client

member.name: T:Subdivisionary.ExternalApis.ExternalApiManager
member.summary: Creates a new thread that runs concurrently to (possibly) trigger a POST/PUT request from an external API. Note that these operation runs parrallel to our main thread, and the result doesn't inform the SAS. So we set a thread lose into the world, knowing that we don't care it ever returns.

member.name: F:Subdivisionary.ExternalApis.ExternalApiManager._apis
member.summary: A list of external apis to trigger

member.name: F:Subdivisionary.ExternalApis.ExternalApiManager._client
member.summary: The HttpClient handling all post/put requests

member.name: F:Subdivisionary.ExternalApis.ExternalApiManager.TIMEOUT_SECONDS
member.summary: Timeout for each API call until a timeout exception is thrown

member.name: M:Subdivisionary.ExternalApis.ExternalApiManager.InvoiceGeneratedAsync(Subdivisionary.Models.Applications.Application,Subdivisionary.Models.InvoiceInfo)
member.summary: Trigger External API when an invoice is generated
member.param: Application that Invoice was generated for

member.name: M:Subdivisionary.ExternalApis.ExternalApiManager.StatusChangedAsync(Subdivisionary.Models.Applications.Application)
member.summary: Trigger External API when a status change has occured (these could include payments)

member.name: M:Subdivisionary.ExternalApis.ExternalApiManager.TimeoutAfter(System.Threading.Tasks.Task,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Task that returns either when a specified task completes or when a timeout occurs. If the returning task is the source task, then the value is returned. Otherwise an exception occurs when the timer runs out
member.param: Timeout timespan before an error is thrown
Application ID for the purposes of logging the error.

member.name: M:Subdivisionary.ExternalApis.ExternalApiManager.InvoiceGeneratedTriggerInBackground(Subdivisionary.Models.Applications.Application,Subdivisionary.Models.InvoiceInfo)
member.summary: Concurrent thread that calls InvoiceGenerated() function on all external APIs.

member.name: M:Subdivisionary.ExternalApis.ExternalApiManager.StatusChangedTriggerInBackground(Subdivisionary.Models.Applications.Application)
member.summary: Concurrent thread that calls StatusChanged() function on all external APIs.

member.summary: List of emails that are invited to edit the project. Okay, there's are reason why this is a SerializableList element, and not ID-based. member.summary: THe Map Review Fee is only charged once an application is deemed submittable. Comes after the processing fee, if at all.

member.name: P:Subdivisionary.Models.FeeScheuleItem.AdditionalFeesMayApplyDisclaimer
member.summary: On the fee schedule of 2016/17, there is a line item that denotes "Minimum fee; Additional fees may be assessed on time and materials basis." True means that this disclaimer is present, and false for this disclaimer is not present

member.name: M:Subdivisionary.Models.FeeScheuleItem.CalculateMapReviewFee(System.Int32)
member.summary: This fee is due once an application is deemed submittable. Note that some applications do not have a secondary fee, so this may return '0'.
member.param: Number of Units could contribute to a linear increase in price, based on if the project is a parcel/final map

member.name: T:Subdivisionary.Models.Forms.CoverLetterSidewalkLegislationForm
member.summary: Structurally, this is no different than a standard Cover Letter. But it will have a different view.

member.name: M:Subdivisionary.Models.Forms.Form.CanCopyProperty(System.Reflection.PropertyInfo)
member.summary:
This method should return false for items that are not directly manipulated by forms within the view.
Basically ask yourself the question, is thisproperty modified directly by a form save? If the answer is no, then this method should return false, and you have to override the method to make sure that the property isn't copied (either by type or by name). If the answer is yes, then no need to override the method since the default assumption is that every variable is directly modifed by a form and should be copied over.

member.name: T:EFeeSchedule
member.summary: The intent of this pseduo-enum class is to encapsulate all possible FeeSchedule items within the database. When a Fee Schedule Item is added/removed into the dbo.FeeScheduleItem table, it should be reflected here. This practice will reduce the number of "magic strings" throughout our application
